standard_metadata.standard_description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent (i.e., when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them).

question.content: **Apply the distributive property to factor out the greatest common factor.**  ${16g + 20h} =$

hints.content: Let's find the greatest common factor of $\blueE{16}$ and $\maroonD{20}$.
$\tealE{4}$ is the greatest common factor of $\blueE{16}$ and $\maroonD{20}$.

question.content: **Apply the distributive property to factor out the greatest common factor.**  ${25p + 50q} =$

hints.content: Let's find the greatest common factor of $\blue{25}$ and $\pink{50}$.
$\green{25}$ is the greatest common factor of $\blue{25}$ and $\pink{50}$.

question.content: **Apply the distributive property to factor out the greatest common factor of all three terms.**  ${9a - 18b + 21c} =$

$\green{3}$ is the greatest common factor of $\blue{9}$, $\pink{18}$,  and $\purple{21}$.
